events.summary: A rugby union side competing in a regional championship has secured a contract extension with its captain, locking in the back-row player for four additional seasons with a reported salary increase and leadership bonus.

outline.sentence: {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced a contract extension for captain {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} made the announcement via a 12:00 BST press release on the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} website and hosted a short media briefing at the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground.
{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} signed a four-season extension running through the end of the 2028-29 {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} season.
The extension takes effect from the start of the 2025-26 campaign and guarantees {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}'s services for the 2025-26, 2026-27, 2027-28 and 2028-29 seasons.
{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} reported that the contract raises {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}'s annual salary to £95,000.

The {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} said this represents an increase from {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}'s previous reported annual salary of £72,000, an uplift of approximately £23,000 per year.
{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} confirmed that the contract for {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} includes a leadership bonus of £20,000 per season.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} stated that the leadership bonus of £20,000 per season is payable in quarterly instalments provided {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} remains club captain and is included in at least two-thirds of {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} matchday squads each season.

{Marina Kestrel|PERSON-2}, director of {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}, said "Retaining {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} secures core leadership for our {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} campaigns."

{Marina Kestrel|PERSON-2} made the remark at the media briefing and highlighted {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}'s role mentoring younger players and his influence on the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s player-development pathway.
{Eden Trask|PERSON-3}, head coach of {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}, said "Cormac Halloway's work rate and experience were decisive factors in this extension."

{Eden Trask|PERSON-3} also cited {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}'s last season contributions — noting that {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} led the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} squad in tackles and minutes played — as part of the reasoning behind the decision.
{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} said "I am committed to {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} and looking forward to leading the group through the next four seasons."
{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} added that he plans to remain based locally to continue community coaching sessions and to help integrate promoted academy players into the senior group.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with {Northbridge Brewing|ORGANIZATION-2} to help balance the 2025 operating budget after the {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} extension.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} confirmed the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with {Northbridge Brewing|ORGANIZATION-2} is reported to be worth approximately £65,000 and will include co-promotional activities on two home matchdays.
{Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} registered the {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} contract extension and confirmed the contract met the competition's salary-cap and registration requirements.

The {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1}'s compliance office confirmed registration on 15 July 2025 after {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} submitted the amended squad list and the financial disclosures required under the competition rules.
{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} promoted academy back-row {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} to the senior squad as a roster consequence of the {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} contract adjustments.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced that 19-year-old academy back-row {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} has signed a one-year development contract, will train with the first team immediately and will be eligible for selection in the matchday 23.

continuation.summary: A local supporters' trust publicly requested a detailed breakdown of Harwick Vale's 2025 operating budget and the terms of the Cormac Halloway extension, warning it will file a formal compliance complaint with the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council within 14 days if the club does not publish the requested financial details.

events.summary: A local supporters' trust publicly requested a detailed breakdown of Harwick Vale's 2025 operating budget and the terms of the Cormac Halloway extension, warning it will file a formal compliance complaint with the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council within 14 days if the club does not publish the requested financial details.

outline.sentence: {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} published a public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting a detailed breakdown of {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s 2025 operating budget and the full terms of the {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} contract extension.

The public letter was dated and signed by the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} chair and four trustees and stated the request was submitted "on behalf of season-ticket holders and local members" who had raised concerns about recent high-profile contract activity at the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} set a 14-day deadline in the published letter and warned it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council if {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} did not publish the requested financial details.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3}'s deadline was specified in the letter as 2025-08-05 and {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} said any formal complaint would be lodged with supporting documentation by email and registered post to the Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance office if no satisfactory disclosure was provided by that date.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} posted the public letter on the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} website and circulated the letter to local media outlets in Harwick-on-Teal.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} confirmed it published the letter at 09:30 BST and distributed PDF copies to local outlets including the {Harwick Gazette|ORGANIZATION-4}, the {Teal Chronicle|ORGANIZATION-5} and {Vale FM|ORGANIZATION-6}, while also emailing a copy directly to the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} communications address.
{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} specifically requested a salary breakdown for {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} that separates base pay, bonuses and any leadership payments.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} asked that the salary breakdown show gross and net figures, the frequency of payments, any appearance- or performance-related bonuses, details of employer pension or National Insurance contributions related to payments to {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1}, and whether any third-party payments were made.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} specifically requested the terms and conditional criteria for the £20,000-per-season leadership bonus included in the {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} extension.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} requested that the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} supply the precise triggering conditions, measurement criteria and any medical or discretionary exemptions for the leadership bonus, and asked how the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would verify and publish each season whether those conditions had been met.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} requested a disclosure of the one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with {Northbridge Brewing|ORGANIZATION-2} and an explanation of how the {Northbridge Brewing|ORGANIZATION-2} agreement affects {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s 2025 operating budget.

{Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} asked for the sponsorship contract value to be shown with its payment schedule, any in-kind elements or matchday revenue guarantees included in the deal with {Northbridge Brewing|ORGANIZATION-2}, and a statement of whether sponsorship receipts had been ear-marked against player remuneration or general operating costs.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} issued a short statement acknowledging receipt of the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} request and said {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would review the letter and seek advice on commercially sensitive information.

The {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} statement, posted on the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} website at 11:45 BST, said {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would consult its legal and financial advisers and aimed to provide a considered reply to the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} while balancing contractual confidentiality and regulatory obligations.

{Marina Kestrel|PERSON-2}, director of {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}, said {Marina Kestrel|PERSON-2} had instructed {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s finance team to prepare a considered response and to engage directly with the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3}.

{Marina Kestrel|PERSON-2} asked the finance team to prepare an initial redacted summary of the 2025 operating budget and to propose dates for a meeting with {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} representatives within ten working days.

Elmstone Regional Rugby Council confirmed Elmstone Regional Rugby Council had not received a formal complaint from {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} as of 2025-07-22 and outlined that any formal complaint would be processed under Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance procedures.

The Elmstone Regional Rugby Council compliance office provided guidance to local media that formal complaints must be submitted in writing with supporting evidence, and it supplied contact details for the designated compliance officer who would acknowledge receipt within five working days of a submission.

{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} issued a brief statement via {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} saying {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} would cooperate with transparency measures and that contractual details should be addressed by {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} and relevant competition offices such as {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance staff.

The {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} statement was released through {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s official channels at 14:05 BST and emphasised that {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} was available to meet {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} representatives for a discussion once {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} and competition offices had clarified what information could be shared publicly.

continuation.summary: Cormac Halloway met informally with two representatives of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust for a moderated community Q&A, reiterated his willingness to cooperate and announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players while deferring contractual and budgetary questions to the club and competition compliance offices.

events.summary: Cormac Halloway met informally with two representatives of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust for a moderated community Q&A, reiterated his willingness to cooperate and announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players while deferring contractual and budgetary questions to the club and competition compliance offices.

outline.sentence: {Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} met informally with {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} representatives {Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} and {Priya Sander|PERSON-6} at {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground for a moderated community question-and-answer session.

The meeting convened at 11:00 BST and included two {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} staff members in attendance as observers: {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s communications officer and the academy manager.

The meeting was arranged following an exchange of emails between {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} and {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} earlier in the week and was described by both sides as an initial, informal engagement rather than a formal grievance hearing.
{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} moderated the community question-and-answer session on behalf of {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.

{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} introduced the session by explaining the format and by stating that the session would follow a moderated Q&A structure with predetermined topics to keep the discussion focused.
The community question-and-answer session lasted 45 minutes and was held in a meeting room at {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground.

The meeting took place in {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s smaller conference room, which seats up to 20 people and features a whiteboard and a wall-mounted timetable of the upcoming preseason schedule.
The session was timed to avoid interfering with first-team training hours and concluded promptly at 11:45 BST to allow coaching staff to begin pitch work at noon.
{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} told attendees that he remained willing to engage with supporters and to participate in community-facing activities organised by {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.

{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} gave examples of past community activities he had taken part in, noting recent school visits and a local youth-clinic he ran last spring, and said he would continue similar outreach while balancing preseason preparations.

{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} announced a schedule of weekly open coaching sessions for promoted academy players to be held at {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s training ground beginning the week commencing 2025-08-04.

The announced weekly coaching sessions were scheduled for Tuesday evenings at 18:00 BST and Saturday mornings at 09:00 BST, with each session planned to last around 75 minutes and to focus on position-specific drills and conditioning.

{Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} indicated the sessions would be limited to players on first-year development contracts and that the academy manager would confirm final participant lists one week before the first session.

{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} said {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would publish the coaching session times and participant eligibility criteria on the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} website by 2025-08-02.

{Dr. Isla Marden|PERSON-7} added that the published notice would include an online sign-up form, a parental-consent template for under-18 players, and a contact email for the academy manager where eligibility queries could be directed.
{Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} asked how {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} would be integrated into first-team training and whether the planned coaching sessions would support that transition.

{Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} requested clarification on whether {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} would be phased into full-contact sessions immediately or given a tailored programme during his first two weeks with the senior squad to ease the transition.

{Rowan Ferley|PERSON-5} also asked whether {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} intended to assign a specific senior player or coach to mentor {Jules Renby|PERSON-4} during his initial integration period.
{Priya Sander|PERSON-6} said {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} would circulate a brief summary of the meeting to season-ticket holders and local members.

{Priya Sander|PERSON-6} confirmed the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} planned to email the summary to its approximate 1,200 subscribed members and to post a short notice on the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3}'s website within 48 hours of the meeting.

{Priya Sander|PERSON-6} added that the circulated summary would exclude any matters both parties agreed were confidential and would invite members to submit follow-up questions for a potential future open forum.

{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} declined to answer contractual and budgetary questions during the session and advised that such inquiries should be directed to {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s finance team and the {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance office.

{Cormac Halloway|PERSON-1} said he had been briefed by {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} not to discuss commercially sensitive matters and suggested that the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} forward specific document requests to the {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1}'s finance team for formal handling.

All participants agreed to seek formal guidance from the {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance office on what contractual information {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} could publish publicly following the meeting.

Attendees agreed that {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} would prepare a short list of precise data items it wished the compliance office to consider and that both the {Harwick Community Supporters' Trust|ORGANIZATION-3} and {Harwick Vale Rugby Club|ORGANIZATION-1} would jointly submit the request for written guidance.

All participants set a target to follow up within seven calendar days by jointly emailing the {Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship|EVENT-1} compliance office to request written guidance on the specific categories of contractual and budgetary information discussed at the session.

continuation.summary: Harwick Community Supporters' Trust emailed a concise summary of the 2025-07-31 Q&A to its roughly 1,200 subscribed members, posted a short notice on its website and attached the shortlist of data items it plans to jointly submit to the Elmstone compliance office, inviting members to endorse that list.

person.name: Cormac Halloway
person.description: Driven and community-minded leader known for a high work ethic, strong discipline, and a focus on mentoring younger athletes while pursuing a long-term playing career.

history.event_update: Cormac Halloway signed a four-season contract extension with Harwick Vale Rugby Club (effective from the 2025-26 season through 2028-29), with his annual salary raised to £95,000 and a £20,000-per-season leadership bonus payable quarterly; the contract was registered with the Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship on 15 July 2025.

person.education: Bachelor of Sports Science, St. Lysander University

person.name: Marina Kestrel
person.description: Strategic and pragmatic administrator with a focus on sustainable club development, youth pathways, and pragmatic financial planning.

history.event_update: Marina Kestrel, director of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, announced the retention of Cormac Halloway at a media briefing and highlighted his leadership, mentoring of younger players, and role in the club's player-development pathway.

person.name: Eden Trask
person.description: Tactical-minded coach who emphasizes disciplined defense, structured training, and the long-term development of players through data-informed methods.

history.event_update: Eden Trask, head coach of Harwick Vale Rugby Club, supported the extension, citing Cormac Halloway's work rate, experience and last-season contributions leading the squad in tackles and minutes played.

person.education: Advanced Coaching Diploma, Vale Institute of Coaching

person.name: Jules Renby
person.description: Athletic and tenacious back-row prospect noted for physical tackling, high work-rate, and strong determination to establish a professional career.

history.event_update: Jules Renby was promoted from the academy to Harwick Vale's senior squad, signing a one-year development contract, joining first-team training immediately and becoming eligible for selection in the matchday 23.

person.profession: Rugby player (development contract; promoted to senior squad)
person.education: Diploma in Sports Performance, Valeview Sports Academy (in progress)

organization.name: Harwick Vale Rugby Club
organization.description: Community-rooted rugby club with a long history of developing regional talent and maintaining strong local engagement.

history.event_update: Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced Cormac Halloway's four-season extension, hosted a media briefing at its training ground, confirmed the salary and leadership-bonus terms, arranged a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing (reported at ~£65,000) to help balance the 2025 operating budget, and promoted academy player Jules Renby to the senior squad; the club submitted amended squad and financial disclosures for registration on 15 July 2025.

organization.mission_statement: To develop local athletic talent, promote community participation in sport, and sustain a competitive club culture.

organization.name: Northbridge Brewing
organization.description: Regional craft brewery producing traditional ales and partnering with local businesses for community events and hospitality.

history.event_update: Northbridge Brewing agreed a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Harwick Vale Rugby Club reported to be worth approximately £65,000 and including co-promotional activities on two home matchdays.

organization.mission_statement: To craft approachable, locally inspired beers while supporting regional hospitality and events.

Cormac Halloway issued a brief statement via Harwick Vale Rugby Club on 2025-07-22 saying he will cooperate with transparency measures and is available to meet Harwick Community Supporters' Trust representatives once the club and competition offices clarify what can be shared publicly.

organization.name: Harwick Community Supporters' Trust
organization.description: A member-led trust that advocates for supporter representation, financial transparency, and community involvement in the governance of local sporting and leisure facilities.

history.event_update: Harwick Community Supporters' Trust published a dated public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting detailed disclosure of Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget and the full terms of Cormac Halloway's contract extension, set a 14-day deadline to 2025-08-05 and warned it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council if unsatisfied.

organization.mission_statement: To represent season-ticket holders and local members by promoting transparent decision-making, safeguarding community access to sport, and supporting sustainable club stewardship.

organization.name: Harwick Gazette
organization.description: A local daily newspaper focused on neighbourhood reporting, public affairs, and community features across the Harwick region.

history.event_update: Harwick Gazette was one of the local media outlets sent a PDF copy of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust public letter, which the Trust posted and distributed at 09:30 BST on 2025-07-22.

organization.mission_statement: To deliver accurate, timely and relevant local news while fostering civic engagement and accountability.

organization.name: Teal Chronicle
organization.description: An independent weekly magazine covering cultural life, local business, and community events across the Teal valley and surrounding towns.

history.event_update: Teal Chronicle received a circulated PDF of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust's public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting financial and contract disclosures from Harwick Vale Rugby Club.

organization.mission_statement: To document and celebrate local culture, support small enterprises, and provide thoughtful reporting on civic issues.

organization.name: Vale FM
organization.description: A community radio broadcaster offering a mix of local news, music programming and volunteer-led shows aimed at connecting neighbourhoods across the Vale region.

history.event_update: Vale FM was emailed a PDF copy of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust public letter on 2025-07-22 and was listed among local outlets the Trust notified about its disclosure request.

organization.mission_statement: To provide accessible on-air and online programming that reflects local tastes, supports community voices, and promotes civic participation.

event.description: Seasonal regional rugby competition that brings together semi-professional clubs across the Elmstone area in a structured league format.

history.event_update: The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship registered Cormac Halloway's contract extension on 15 July 2025 and confirmed the contract met the competition's salary-cap and registration requirements.

The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship was cited as the relevant competition office for compliance matters in the correspondence; the Championship had previously registered Cormac Halloway's contract extension on 2025-07-15.

person.education: PhD in Sports Sociology, St. Lysander University

organization.name: Harwick Vale Rugby Club
organization.description: Community-rooted rugby club with a long history of developing regional talent and maintaining strong local engagement.

history.event_update: Harwick Vale Rugby Club announced Cormac Halloway's four-season extension, hosted a media briefing at its training ground, confirmed the salary and leadership-bonus terms, arranged a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Northbridge Brewing (reported at ~£65,000) to help balance the 2025 operating budget, and promoted academy player Jules Renby to the senior squad; the club submitted amended squad and financial disclosures for registration on 15 July 2025.

Harwick Vale Rugby Club acknowledged receipt of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust letter on 2025-07-22, said it would consult legal and financial advisers about commercially sensitive information, and tasked its finance team with preparing a redacted 2025 operating-budget summary and meeting proposals for the Trust.

Harwick Vale Rugby Club hosted the 45-minute moderated community Q&A at its training ground (with two staff observers present), announced weekly coaching sessions limited to first-year development-contract players starting the week commencing 2025-08-04, and agreed to work with the Trust to seek written guidance from the Elmstone compliance office on what contractual and budgetary information can be published.

organization.mission_statement: To develop local athletic talent, promote community participation in sport, and sustain a competitive club culture.

organization.name: Northbridge Brewing
organization.description: Regional craft brewery producing traditional ales and partnering with local businesses for community events and hospitality.

history.event_update: Northbridge Brewing agreed a one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Harwick Vale Rugby Club reported to be worth approximately £65,000 and including co-promotional activities on two home matchdays.

Northbridge Brewing's one-year front-of-shirt sponsorship with Harwick Vale Rugby Club was the subject of a disclosure request in the Trust's public letter of 2025-07-22, which asked for the sponsorship value, payment schedule and any in-kind elements.

organization.mission_statement: To craft approachable, locally inspired beers while supporting regional hospitality and events.

organization.name: Harwick Community Supporters' Trust
organization.description: A member-led trust that advocates for supporter representation, financial transparency, and community involvement in the governance of local sporting and leisure facilities.

history.event_update: Harwick Community Supporters' Trust published a dated public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting detailed disclosure of Harwick Vale Rugby Club's 2025 operating budget and the full terms of Cormac Halloway's contract extension, set a 14-day deadline to 2025-08-05 and warned it would file a formal compliance complaint with Elmstone Regional Rugby Council if unsatisfied.

Harwick Community Supporters' Trust met with the club, agreed to prepare and circulate a short meeting summary to its approx. 1,200 subscribed members within 48 hours (excluding confidential matters), agreed to prepare a shortlist of data items for the compliance office, and to jointly request written guidance from the Elmstone compliance office within seven calendar days.

organization.mission_statement: To represent season-ticket holders and local members by promoting transparent decision-making, safeguarding community access to sport, and supporting sustainable club stewardship.

organization.name: Harwick Gazette
organization.description: A local daily newspaper focused on neighbourhood reporting, public affairs, and community features across the Harwick region.

history.event_update: Harwick Gazette was one of the local media outlets sent a PDF copy of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust public letter, which the Trust posted and distributed at 09:30 BST on 2025-07-22.

organization.mission_statement: To deliver accurate, timely and relevant local news while fostering civic engagement and accountability.

organization.name: Teal Chronicle
organization.description: An independent weekly magazine covering cultural life, local business, and community events across the Teal valley and surrounding towns.

history.event_update: Teal Chronicle received a circulated PDF of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust's public letter on 2025-07-22 requesting financial and contract disclosures from Harwick Vale Rugby Club.

organization.mission_statement: To document and celebrate local culture, support small enterprises, and provide thoughtful reporting on civic issues.

organization.name: Vale FM
organization.description: A community radio broadcaster offering a mix of local news, music programming and volunteer-led shows aimed at connecting neighbourhoods across the Vale region.

history.event_update: Vale FM was emailed a PDF copy of the Harwick Community Supporters' Trust public letter on 2025-07-22 and was listed among local outlets the Trust notified about its disclosure request.

organization.mission_statement: To provide accessible on-air and online programming that reflects local tastes, supports community voices, and promotes civic participation.

event.name: Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship
event.description: Seasonal regional rugby competition that brings together semi-professional clubs across the Elmstone area in a structured league format.

history.event_update: The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship registered Cormac Halloway's contract extension on 15 July 2025 and confirmed the contract met the competition's salary-cap and registration requirements.

The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship was cited as the relevant competition office for compliance matters in the correspondence; the Championship had previously registered Cormac Halloway's contract extension on 2025-07-15.

The Elmstone Regional Rugby Championship was identified during the meeting as the relevant competition compliance office, and participants agreed to jointly email the Championship within seven calendar days to request written guidance on what contractual and budgetary information Harwick Vale may publish.

summary: A rugby union side competing in a regional championship has secured a contract extension with its captain, locking in the back-row player for four additional seasons with a reported salary increase and leadership bonus.

event_type.category: Player Transfers, Trades, and Contract Signings
